is it true that x uses max 24b of color?
i thought they were 24 plus the implicit 8 of transp
Currently, yes. Once there's more hardware supporting stuff like 36 bit colour, that may change
There's up to 32 bits of data per pixel. Only 24 bits of that are colour.
mgj59: i know the theory
mgj59: just wanted to know if x was using other terminology
X supports 32 bits per pixel, but not 32 bits of colour per pixel
mgj59: because win includes the transparency
So it'll be defined as 24 bit colour even if you're using 32 bits per pixel
